section.name: Introduction
section.p:
The
openArchitectureWare
project produces a powerful framework to build Generators for MDSD (Model-Driven-Software-Development) purposes.

As a controller for the generation-process there is the Workflow-Component. With this component you can start multiple task you need to run to process the generation of code. With this Workflow-Component you can execute all task you have in a MDSD-Environment: Code-Generation, Model-2-Model-Transformation, Clean-Ups...
For this Workflow-Component there is an Eclipse-Plugin to execute your defined workflow comfortably.

With this Maven2-Plugin you can integrate your workflow in your Build-Environment. This plugin is highly configurable. All things must be done only once, so you can use the Eclipse-Plugin and this Maven2-Plugin without duplicate the configuration.

ul.li: The worklow definition file can be freely configured
The property mechanism of the Workflow-Component is reused in the Maven2-Plugin
Support for 2 different source directories are included. This both directories will be appended to the compile classpath
A list of resources can be configured to check whether they are up-to-date. If all resources older than the last generator-run, so the plugin stops the execution.
